feels.name: Compassion
feels.quote: I know the unhappy mistakes about you. I knew them from the first moment to be mistakes. You have never done anything vile. You would not do anything dishonorable.

feels.name: Empathy
feels.quote: I would take any pains to clear you. I have very little to do. There is nothing better that I can do in the world.

feels.name: Hope
feels.quote: I think you see now that you spoke too scrupulously. The hospital would be one good; and making your life quite whole and well again would be another.

feels.name: Sympathy
feels.quote: May I go and see her? Would she accept my sympathy? I would tell her that you have not been blamable before any one’s judgment but your own.

feels.name: Despair
feels.quote: I have lost all spirit about carrying on my life here.

feels.name: Relief
feels.quote: The fact is, this trouble has come upon her confusedly. We have not been able to speak to each other about it. I am not sure what is in her mind about it: she may fear that I have really done something base.

feels.name: Vulnerability
feels.quote: The thing that I might like to do if I were alone, is become impossible to me. I can’t see her miserable.

Places.name: Library
Places.description: A room in the house where Dorothea and Lydgate are having a conversation.
